Fyi for those scrolling through here:
"Kill downed Necron or gather its CP" and "Break computer or take its money" aren't choices at all, you can do both, there's just an order to them. Yoink CP, then kill the spooky boy. Scan the rig for money, then make it rue the day it was ever made. Easy.

Edit: Small correction, killing a downed Necron from afar while it still as CP will still give you its CP.

What I love is the mechanicus have robotoized voices. The necrons have humanistic voices. The mechanicus tossed their humanity away willingly, while the necrons lost theirs in bonds. But, we "hear" who has kept their true origins true. The mechanicus are no longer human despite having souls, and the necrons are still necrontyr despite their lack of souls.

I have never played a Warhammer 40K game, neither tabletop nor PC, but I have played isometric classics like Fallout 1. While I'm not as familiar with XCOM, I am attracted to turn-based combat with an eagle-eyed view. The lore of the Adeptus Mechanicus particularly appeals to me, and you could say I'm a fan of that faction. I have limited knowledge of the overall 40K lore, as I haven't read any books, but I have watched several reviews and story summaries on YouTube, and it's truly fascinating.
After watching this review, I believe I could actually enjoy this game.
cheers

Excellent work at explaining the mechanics (no pun intended) of the game, and the little bits of important and not-so-important (to non W40K fans) details. I am making my way through the ‚ÄúForges of Mars‚Äù omnibus at present, starting ‚ÄúPriests of Mars‚Äù and while not as detailed about that faction as I'd like, it's the first series of novels that tackles this faction. Love the game, as it is obviously made by passionate devs.

It was my first WH40K video game, and I'm hooked now. I've known about the brand and the minis for decades, but never got into it...I'd rather paint canvases and sell them than paint minis and sink all of my money into them.

One thing about your description. Instead of saying they're Amazon...say they're multiple Amazons. Each Mechanicus world is pretty much autonomous and each specializes in some different piece of tech, which they guard jealously. Which is why their planets are some of the best defended in the Imperium. If one is lost, a piece of vital technology could be lost.

I loved the 'voice' samples so much I looked up a tutorial on how to extract them. Now I have Faustinius and the others as my message ringtones, and it's glorious to see how much it weirds out normies when my phone goes off.
Also, 7:28 takes the cake as the funniest shit I've seen in a Warhammer review. xD
